name: Archer
description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Baghlah
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Battering Ram
description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

name: Camel Archer
description:
Highly mobile and durable ranged unit.
+Bonus damage vs Spearmen
-High cost

name: Camel Rider
description:
Highly mobile and durable melee unit effective against all cavalry.
+Bonus damage to cavalry
+Causes enemy cavalry to deal less damage
-High cost

name: Counterweight Trebuchet
description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

name: Crossbowman
description:
High damage ranged unit best against heavy targets.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Culverin
description:
Long-range mobile cannon with bonus vs buildings.
+ Effective against Defenses
+ Does not require setup to fire

name: Dhow
description:
Light war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability and speed.
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Explosive Dhow
description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

name: Fishing Boat
description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

name: Ghulam
description:
Tough infantry that deal two attacks in rapid succession.
+ High armor
+ Higher attack damage on charge
- Lower base attack damage than a Man-at-Arms
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Handcannoneer
description:
Powerful all-purpose ranged infantry.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Horseman
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Imam
description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

name: Lancer
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Mangonel
description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.
+ Effective against massed units
- Must be set up to fire

name: Scout
description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

name: Spearman
description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

name: Springald
description:
Anti-unit siege weapon. Fires bolts that pierce multiple units.
+ Does not require setup to fire
+ Bonus damage vs. melee infantry
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

name: Trade Caravan
description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

name: Trade Ship
description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

name: Transport Ship
description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
- No combat

name: Villager
description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat

name: Xebec
description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

name: Atabeg
description: Can be garrisoned into any military production building to grant +20% health to newly trained units.

name: Bedouin Skirmisher
description:
Ranged infantry wielding a javelin to fend off lightly armored enemies.
+ Bonus against light infantry
+ Long Range
- Weak against cavalry

Requires the Trade Wing - Bazaar

name: Bedouin Swordsman
description:
Master Swordsman who excels in melee combat
+ Bonus vs Melee units
- Weak to ranged units

Requires the Trade Wing - Bazaar

name: Camel Lancer
description:
Higher mobility Lancer with a more powerful charge, but less powerful melee attack. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Dervish
description:
Mounted Religious unit. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Uses a powerful Mass Heal ability to heal friendly units in an area.
+ Gains increased Healing when carrying a relic.
+ High speed.

name: Desert Raider
description:
Versatile Cavalry unit that can swap between ranged and melee attacks with a toggle.
+ Effective against Light Infantry in Ranged Mode
+ Effective against Cavalry in Melee Mode
- High cost
- Weak to Ranged units

name: Manjaniq
description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.
+ Effective against massed units
+ Can use Incendiary projectiles for devastating area damage
 - Must be set up to fire

name: Tower of the Sultan
description:
Massive infantry transport effective against buildings and walls. Move speed increases for each unit garrisoned inside.
+ Fires arrows
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Slow move speed when empty

name: Arbaltrier
description:
High damage ranged unit with a defensive pavise shield. Best used when supported by others.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
+ Comes with melee armor
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 4 units for a total of 440 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Bombard
description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

name: Carrack
description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

name: Cataphract
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful Trample ability that charges through enemies.
+ Heavy armor
+ Trample deals area damage
- No base charge attack
- Slower move speed
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Cheirosiphon
description:
Durable infantry transport equipped with Greek Fire, effective against Buildings and Walls.
+ Greek Fire persists on ground
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Only attacks buildings
- Slow move speed

name: Demolition Ship
description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

name: Dromon
description:
Military ship equipped a flamethrower that can be upgraded to use Greek Fire.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Low weapon range
- Countered by Demolition Ships

name: Galley
description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Grenadier
description:
Advanced ranged infantry with thrown explosive canisters that deal damage in a small area.
+ Deals area damage
- Low single target damage
- Slow movement speed

Mercenary that can be purchased per 2 units for a total of 480 Olive Oil.

Requires the Silk Road Contract.

name: Horse Archer
description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against slower melee units.
+ High mobility
- Weak vs ranged units

Mercenary that can be purchased per 3 units for a total of 330 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Huihui Pao
description:
Massive siege engine with incredible range, extra effective at destroying buildings and walls.
+ Extremely long range
- Must be set up to fire

Mercenary that can be purchased for 1000 Olive Oil.

name: Javelin Thrower
description:
Ranged infantry effective against other ranged units.
+ Anti-ranged specialist
+ Increased weapon range
+ Comes with ranged armor
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Keshik
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
+ Restores health after every attack
- Less health than Lancers
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 2 units for a total of 400 Olive Oil.

Requires the Eastern Mercenary Contract.

name: Landsknecht
description:
Brave unarmored infantry with an enormous two-handed sword, effective in mixed armies.
+ Melee attack deals area damage
- Low health
- Countered by Archers

Mercenary that can be purchased per 3 units for a total of 480 Olive Oil.

Requires the Western Mercenary Contract.

name: Limitanei
description:
Infantry best used against cavalry. Can enter Shield Wall to take reduced ranged damage.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
+ Increased health
- Shield Wall reduces move speed
- Weak vs heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

name: Longbowman
description:
Cheap long-ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ Long range
+ Can construct Palings to fend off cavalry charges
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 5 units for a total of 470 Olive Oil.

Requires the Western Mercenary Contract.

name: Mangudai
description:
Confounding mobile ranged cavalry that can fire while moving.
+ High rate of fire
- Low weapon range

Mercenary that can be purchased per 3 units for a total of 435 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Monk
description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

name: Musofadi Warrior
description:
Infantry effective at ambush attacks and countering heavy targets.
+ Can enter stealth
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Archers
- Capital Town Centers, Outposts, and Scouts can spot stealth

Mercenary that can be purchased per 5 units for a total of 360 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Nest of Bees
description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.
+ Good area of effect damage against most targets
- Slowest movement speed
- Weak if surrounded

Mercenary that can be purchased for 600 Olive Oil.

name: Royal Cannon
description:
Most powerful siege cannon. Excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ Bonus damage to buildings

Mercenary that can be purchased for 900 Olive Oil.

name: Royal Knight
description:
Gain bonus damage for 5 seconds after charging. Effective against most units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 2 units for a total of 460 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Siege Tower
description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

name: Sipahi
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units. Can gain attack speed at the cost of melee defense.
+ High movement speed
+ Strong against ranged units
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 3 units for a total of 450 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Streltsy
description:
Most powerful ranged infantry with reasonable melee capabilities. Increased attack speed while stationary.
+ High damage
+ Lower cost than Handcannoneer
- Slow movement speed

Mercenary that can be purchased per 3 units for a total of 720 Olive Oil.

Requires the Western Mercenary Contract.

name: Tower Elephant
description:
Powerful ranged cavalry that can fire while moving.
+ High health
+ Mounted with powerful Archers
+ Capable of attacking Stone Walls
- Slow movement speed

Mercenary that can be purchased for 1000 Olive Oil.

Requires the Eastern Mercenary Contract.

name: Trader
description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

name: Varangian Guard
description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Can use Berserking to increase damage for reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
+ Increases armor of Transports
+ Disembarking from Transport Ships grants move speed
+ Increased armor near allied Wonders
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: War Elephant
description:
Heavy cavalry effective against cavalry, siege engines, walls, and buildings.
+ High health and armor
+ Mounted with an advanced Spearman
+ Capable of attacking Stone Walls
- Slow movement speed

Mercenary that can be purchased for 680 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Zhuge Nu
description:
Fires bolts with a ferocious damage potential against enemy units.
+ High rate of fire
- Ineffective vs high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

Mercenary that can be purchased per 5 units for a total of 360 Olive Oil.

This Mercenary can only be purchased on Mercenary Houses built near a neutral Trade Post that list this unit. The chance of this unit being available on a Trade Post is 20%.

name: Baochuan
description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

name: Clocktower Battering Ram
description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

name: Clocktower Bombard
description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

name: Clocktower Counterweight Trebuchet
description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

name: Clocktower Nest of Bees
description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.
+ Good area of effect damage against most targets
- Slowest movement speed
- Weak if surrounded

name: Clocktower Springald
description:
Anti-unit siege weapon. Fires bolts that pierce multiple units.
+ Does not require setup to fire
+ Bonus damage vs. melee infantry
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

name: Explosive Junk
description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

name: Fire Lancer
description:
Cavalry wielding explosive-tipped lances.
+ Charge deals area damage
+ Effective at raiding buildings and siege engines
+ Good ranged armor
- Weak in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Imperial Official
description:
Economic support unit with no combat capability. Automatically gathers Tax (Gold) from buildings.
+ Can supervise buildings to improve their efficiency
- Only a certain number of Officials can exist at a time

name: Junk
description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Palace Guard
description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Move faster than Men-At-Arms, but with reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen.

name: War Junk
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Ghazi Raider
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
+ Increased effectiveness against heavy units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Man-at-Arms
description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Scholar
description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can be garrisoned in a Mosque or Madrasa to research technology more quickly. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

name: Sultan's Elite Tower Elephant
description:
Powerful ranged cavalry that can fire while moving.
+ High health
+ Mounted with Handcannoneers
+ Capable of attacking Stone Walls
- Slow movement speed

name: Hulk
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Knight
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Ribauldequin
description:
Five-barreled gunpowder weapon effective against massed units. Deals little damage to buildings.
+ Can hit multiple targets in a single volley
- Short range
- Low ranged armor

name: Wynguard Footman
description:
Specialized man at arms with high health and pierce armor.
- Slow movement
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: Wynguard Ranger
description:
Master longbowmen with increased range and damage, good vs. unarmored targets.
+ Long range
+ Can construct Palings to fend off cavalry charges
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Cannon
description:
Most powerful siege cannon. Excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ Bonus damage to buildings

name: Galleass
description:
Large oared vessel with a powerful forward mounted bombard.
+ Long Range
+ Anti-structure specialist

name: Royal Culverin
description:
Long-range mobile cannon with bonus vs buildings.
+ Effective against Defenses
+ Does not require setup to fire

name: Royal Ribauldequin
description:
Five-barreled gunpowder weapon effective against massed units. Deals little damage to buildings.
+ Can hit multiple targets in a single volley
- Short range
- Low ranged armor

name: War Cog
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Batu Khan
description:
Melee cavalry leader that buffs the attack damage of nearby allies while the Khan is attacking. Can only be recruited from the Golden Tent.
+ Durable heavy cavalry
+ Automatically improves with each Age
- Only one Khan per Golden Horde player

name: Kharash
description:
Low health and damage melee infantry that passively increases the armor of nearby units.
+ Low cost and large recruitment batch 
- Weak against all types

name: Kipchak Archer
description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against slower melee units and will cause units hit to bleed. Any healing will remove the bleed.
+ High mobility
- Low damage
- Weak vs ranged units

name: Light Junk
description:
Light war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability and speed.
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Rus Tribute
description:
Rus heavy infantry called into service by the Golden Horde.
+ Faster than other heavy infantry
+ Faster attack speed
+ Additional damage against cavalry
- Less armored
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Shaman
description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

name: Torguud
description:
Expensive cavalry with high health and melee armor. Effective against melee units. Protects the Khan when nearby by redirecting damage to themselves and can heal the Khan while out of combat. 
+ Heavy armor
+ High Health
+ Automatically improves with each Age
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Traction Trebuchet
description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a long distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
+ High mobility
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

name: Black Rider
description:
Expensive cavalry with high armor and a powerful arquebus. Effective against melee units. Has the Caracole ability.
Only 5 Riders can be trained for each standing Keep built.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: Prelate
description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Automatically inspires Villagers to greatly improve their gather rate. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

name: Hobelar
description:
Cheap cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ Cheaper than a normal Horseman
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Yeoman
description:
Quick and long-ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ Long Range
+ Fast movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Atakebune
description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with rockets.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Vulnerable vs. Incendiary Ships
- Low movement speed

name: Buddhist Monk
description:
Support unit with the ability to decrease enemy attack damage. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Reduced cost
+ Conversion enhances friendly unit damage
+ Automatically reduces enemy attack damage
+ Heals units

name: Handcannon Ashigaru
description:
Powerful all-purpose ranged infantry.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Katana Bannerman
description:
Samurai with an aura that increases damage of melee infantry. Comes with the Deflective Armor ability that periodically blocks attacks.
+ Banner drops on death
+ Heavy armor
+ Increased move speed
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Mounted Samurai
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack. Comes with the Deflective Armor ability that periodically blocks attacks.
+ Heavy armor
+ Deflective Armor recharges out of combat
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Onna-Bugeisha
description:
Light melee infantry with fast attack speed and long weapon range.
+ Fast attack speed
+ Fast move speed
+ Long weapon range
- Weak against heavy targets
- Countered by Archers, Knights

name: Onna-Musha
description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against heavy units.
+ Fast move speed
+ Long weapon range
+ Bonus damage vs. heavy units
- Weak vs ranged units

name: Ozutsu
description:
Ranged infantry equipped with a huge gunpowder weapon that has good weapon range, siege, and splash damage.
+ Anti-building
+ Area damage
- Slow move speed
- Slow attack speed
- Countered by Horsemen and Crossbowmen

name: Samurai
description:
Heavy infantry with good damage and defense. Comes with the Deflective Armor ability that periodically blocks attacks.
+ Heavy armor
+ Deflective Armor recharges out of combat
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Shinobi
description:
Melee infantry that specializes in scouting, sabotage, and assassination.
+ Disguise as enemy Villagers
+ Bonus damage vs. melee
+ Health regeneration
- Capital Town Centers, Outposts, and Scouts can spot disguises

Heals passively.

name: Shinto Priest
description:
Support unit with unique privileges to hold and deposit Yorishiro into buildings. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Yorishiro provide unique bonuses
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow move speed

name: Uma Bannerman
description:
Mounted Samurai with an aura that increases damage of cavalry. Comes with the Deflective Armor ability that periodically blocks attacks.
+ Banner drops on death
+ Fast move speed
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Yumi Ashigaru
description:
Quick and cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ Increased move speed
+ Cheaper than Archers
- Reduced health
- Weak against high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Yumi Bannerman
description:
Ranged Samurai with an aura that increases damage of ranged infantry. Comes with the Deflective Armor ability that periodically blocks attacks.
+ Banner drops on death
+ Fast move speed
- Weak against high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Jeanne's Champion
description:
Tough infantry that excels at countering Spearmen.
+ High armor
+ Bonus damage against Spearmen
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

Upgrades to Elite when Jeanne reaches level 4.

name: Jeanne's Rider
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering Crossbowmen.
+ High movement speed
+ Bonus damage against Crossbowmen
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

Upgrades to Elite when Jeanne reaches level 4.

name: Chevalier Confrere
description:
Heavy cavalry with high damage. Gains health from nearby Heavy Cavalry.
+ Cheaper than a regular knight
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Condottiero
description:
Fast Heavy Infantry that deals more and takes less damage from Gunpowder units.
+ High damage
+ Moves quickly
- High Gold cost

name: Genitour
description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry that throws javelins.
+ High mobility
+ Exceptional versus ranged units
+ High ranged armor
- Weak versus Melee

name: Genoese Crossbowman
description:
High damage ranged unit effective against Melee Infantry.
+ High damage
- Low health
- Countered by Horseman

name: Heavy Spearman
description:
Heavy Infantry excellent against mounted units.
+ Stronger when close to Fortresses
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ High armor
+ Has a stronger spearwall
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: Hospitaller Knight
description:
Tough infantry with good damage, heals friendly units.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Serjeant
description:
Sturdy infantry that throws axes which deal melee damage from range.
+ Strong versus melee units
- Weak versus ranged units

name: Szlachta Cavalry
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and ranged armor. Slows enemy's attack speed when attacking.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong versus Light Infantry
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Templar Brother
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Teutonic Knight
description:
Extremely powerful and Expensive Heavy Infantry. Lowers the armor of nearby enemy units. Becomes more powerful after defeating an enemy.
+ Excellent in melee combat
- Weak to Crossbowmen
- Low Mobility

name: Venetian Galley
description:
Large oared vessel with a long range forward mounted Trebuchet.
+ Long Range
+ Anti-structure specialist

name: Venetian Trader
description:
An expensive and fast Trader that generates Gold by travelling between its Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
You may have a maximum of 5 Venetian Traders.

name: Atgeirmar
description:
Infantry best used against mounted units. Attacks faster with nearby Varangians.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers

name: Attack Ship
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Bogmar
description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets. Has an ability to pierce enemy armor for reduced move speed.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Hippodrome Horseman
description:
Fast cavalry that enhances damage of nearby cavalry.
+ High movement speed
+ Health regeneration
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Hippodrome Riddari
description:
Elite varangian cavalry that can enhance the movement speed of nearby infantry. 
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Hippodrome Scout
description:
Lightly armed cavalry with increased vision and damage. Comes with an aura that increases damage of torches.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

name: Riddari
description:
Cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Has an ability to throw axes from range.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Warship
description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

name: Donso
description:
Infantry best used against mounted units. Periodically throws a javelin when attacking from ranged.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
+ Comes with melee armor
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers and Longbowmen

name: Freeborn Warrior
description:
Infantry with high ranged armor and bonus against ranged.
+ Strong against ranged units
-weak against heavy melee units

name: Hunting Canoe
description:
Light war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability and speed.
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Mansa Javelineer
description:
Ranged infantry effective against other ranged units. Moves faster and deals poison damage.
+ Anti-ranged specialist
+ Increased weapon range
+ Comes with ranged armor
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Mansa Musofadi Warrior
description:
Infantry effective at ambush attacks and countering heavy targets. Has additional melee armor and health.
+ Can enter stealth
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Archers
- Capital Town Centers, Outposts, and Scouts can spot stealth

name: Musofadi Gunner
description:
Powerful ranged infantry effective at ambush attacks.
+ Increased movement speed
+ Can enter stealth
+ High damage
- High cost

name: Sofa
description:
Cheaper heavy cavalry for reduced health and armor.
+ High movement speed
+ Cheaper cost
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: War Canoe
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Warrior Scout
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Increased health regeneration
+ Increased move speed
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
- Weak in combat

name: Khaganate Elite Horse Archer
description:
Highly mobile ranged cavalry effective against slower melee units.
+ High mobility
- Weak vs ranged units

Randomly spawns 5 at the time from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khaganate Elite Knight
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

Randomly spawns 3 at the time from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khaganate Elite Mangudai
description:
Confounding mobile ranged cavalry that can fire while moving.
+ High rate of fire
- Low weapon range

Randomly spawns from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khaganate Nest of Bees
description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.
+ Good area of effect damage against most targets
- Slowest movement speed
- Weak if surrounded

Randomly spawns from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khaganate Elite Palace Guard
description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Move faster than Men-At-Arms, but with reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen.

Randomly spawns 5 at the time from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khaganate Warrior Monk
description:
Military-minded support unit that improves combat capabilities of nearby units after it attacks. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
+ High utility in large armies
- Low damage

Randomly spawns 2 at the time from the Khaganate Palace.

name: Khan
description:
Ranged Cavalry Leader able to use Signal Arrows to enhance nearby military units. Reappears at a Town Center if killed.
+ Vision and herding of a Scout
+ Automatically improves with each Age
- Only one Khan per Mongol player

name: Khan's Hunter
description:
Supporting Cavalry Archer that can fire while moving. Has the Khan's Hunter Aura that improves the range of nearby ranged units.
+High Mobility
+Excellent Vision
-Low Health

name: Gilded Archer
description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets and increased fire rate and longer weapon range than standard Archers.
+ Increased weapon range
+ Faster attack speed
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Gilded Crossbowman
description:
Crossbowmen with increased range and exceptionally high damage against heavy units.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
+ Long range
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Gilded Handcannoneer
description:
More powerful all-purpose ranged infantry with increased attack speed.
+ High damage
+ Increased attack speed
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Gilded Horseman
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Gilded Knight
description:
Expensive cavalry with a powerful charge.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Gilded Landsknecht
description:
Brave unarmored infantry with an enormous two-handed sword, effective in mixed armies.
+ Melee attack deals area damage
- Low health
- Countered by Archers

name: Gilded Man-at-Arms
description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Gilded Spearman
description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

name: Gilded Villager
description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units. Gathers resources 28% quicker and builds and repairs 20% faster than regular Villagers.
- Weak in combat

name: Akinji
description:
Highly mobile long ranged cavalry which fires two arrows in quick succession. 
+ High mobility
- Weak vs ranged units

name: Grand Galley
description:
Large oared vessel which can be upgraded into a naval Military School.
+ Large hold which can be garrisoned by any unit once upgraded into a Military School
+ Very long range
- Lower damage

name: Great Bombard
description:
Largest cannon that can be fielded. Excellent against buildings or groups of targets.
+ High damage
+ Area damage
+ Long Range
- Must be set up to fire

name: Janissary
description:
Powerful infantry effective against cavalry and can repair siege engines.
+ High damage
+ Bonus damage against cavalry
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Receives additional damage from Archers.

name: Mehter
description:
War drummer that enhances units in an area, except Villagers and Traders.
+ War drum military enhancements
+ High movement speed
- No weapons

name: Lodya Attack Ship
description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

name: Lodya Demolition Ship
description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
+ The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

name: Lodya Fishing Boat
description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Does not require a Dock to drop off gathered Food and gathers faster than a regular Fishing Boat.
- No combat
The Lodya Fishing Boat can be converted to any other type of ship.

name: Lodya Galley
description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

name: Lodya Trade Ship
description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship.

name: Lodya Transport Ship
description:
Can be garrisoned by any unit and uses their sight range. Allows garrisoned units to be transport across water.
The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship.

name: Militia
description:
Light melee infantry equipped with a polearm.
+ Fast moving
- Countered by Archers
- Can't garrison
- Loses life over time

name: Warrior Monk
description:
Military-minded support unit that improves combat capabilities of nearby units after it attacks. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
+ High utility in large armies
- Low damage

name: Daimyo
description:
High health and damage melee cavalry that provides an aura that increases attack speed of nearby military units. Effective against melee units. Limited to one per Daimyo Estate built.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Ikko-ikki Monk
description:
Warrior Monk with strong combat capabilities that heals nearby units when attacking. Does not have a targeted heal ability.
+ Can heal themselves
- Slow move speed

name: Kanabo Samurai
description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Deals +6% of enemy max health as bonus damage.
+ High health
+ Strong against high health units 
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: Mounted Samurai Levy
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and a powerful charge attack.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

name: Naginata Samurai
description:
Heavy infantry with good damage and defense.
+ Heavy armor
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Naginata Samurai Levy
description:
Heavy infantry with good damage and defense.
+ Heavy armor
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

name: Spearman Levy
description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

name: Tanegashima Ashigaru
description:
Powerful ranged infantry that is effective against armored units.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Tanegashima Ashigaru Levy
description:
Powerful ranged infantry that is effective against armored units.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Yari Cavalry
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units. Bonus damage against cavalry.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Yari Cavalry Levy
description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units. Bonus damage against cavalry.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Yatai
description:
Collects Food from nearby sources without consuming them in addition to a base rate of 20 Food every minute. After collecting enough Food it will send a trader to its Home Matsuri, which improves the Matsuri gather rate aura by 5%, +250 health and grants +50 additional Food. 
Food sources overlapped by multiple Yatai are only counted once and Boar do not retaliate while near a Yatai. The Yatai is limited to 3 and is increased by +1 per age up.

name: Yumi Ashigaru Levy
description:
Quick and cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ Increased move speed
+ Cheaper than Archers
- Reduced health
- Weak against high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

name: Amir Warrior
description:
Powerful Heavy Infantry trained for free that excels in combat near to Tughlaqabad Forts. 
+ No population cost
+ High health and armor
- Rapidly loses strength away from Tughlaqabad Forts
- Countered by Crossbowmen

name: Ballista Elephant
description:
Ballista mounted elephant effective at dealing with melee infantry and hitting multiple targets.
+ High health and armor
+ Bonus damage vs. melee
- Slow movement speed

name: Healer Elephant
description:
Support elephant with two mounted Imams that individually heal allied units. Gains additional damage from nearby melee infantry and captures Sacred Sites.
+ High health and armor
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Spearman & Crossbowmen

name: Raider Elephant
description:
Fast elephant effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units. Can use the Trample ability to bypass any unit to deal damage in an area.
+ High health
+ Fast movement speed
+ Charges longer distances
- Countered by Spearmen

name: Worker Elephant
description:
Hardworking support Elephant.
+ Universal resource drop-off
+ Bonus to all resources dropped off
+ Requires no Population - maximum 20
- Slow movement speed

name: Imperial Guard
description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

Requires Dynastic Protectors researched at Zhu Xi's Library.

name: Shaolin Monk
description:
Monk with strong combat capabilities.
+ Strong against ranged units 
+ Can heal themselves
- Cannot heal others

name: Yuan Raider
description:
Extremely swift light cavalry which deals bonus damage to economic units.
+ Fast move speed
+ Bonus damage vs Villagers
- Weak in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen

Requires Dynastic Protectors researched at Zhu Xi's Library.
